@ Coolum, almost every new piece of media (games, videos, music, programs) is being watched.  If they are watching one version of this movie that are essentially watching all. Protect yourself and block IPs.


Jackie Chan plays his part extremely well as usual.
He plays the part of this funny, serious Kung Fu trainer. As usual, he likes to mix those two parts up together, providing and interesting role for him.

Jaden Smith, as young as he is, plays a great part as well. I see a decent start to his career.

Best thing I can say is, do not analyze the hell out of this movie. Watch it and enjoy. Not every film is going to be a box office hit. If you like some Kung Fu, Jackie Chan, a bit of humor, and a pretty good story. Then watch this film. If you do not really care for at least most of those attributes that I named off, then do not bother watching this film, because you will just be on here a bit afterwards complaining at how bad 'you' thought the movie was. 

                                    Thank you,

                                           Mr. 320
